title: Why Are There So Many Trolls?
body:
Why can't people just play seriously, even when they begin losing? I can understand in a completely one sided game messing around, because those games are damn near impossible to come back in. When it's possible to win however, I really don't get why people start trolling their own team. Flashing for no reason, running into the enemies and dying like it was an accident, pretending to have dc'd, I just can't understand it. Last game I played this Twitch lost lane sometime around 20 minutes and then proceeded to make the enemy team chase him around while he stealthed away. This guy wasted a lot of time, he died 2-3 times, and ultimately he pissed our whole team off and costed us the game. Meanwhile he responds to everything in the chat with "I'm not 12." and "lol". The game was completely winnable if we had this player contributing like he should have been, but he did not.

The worse part about it is, reporting something like this doesn't do anything. He didn't have an abnormal amount of deaths. He was still farming from time to time, he just wasn't playing like any normal player would have been in the same situation. In better words, intentionally throwing the game without breaking the rules. What is driving people like this? It's terrible that people would even want to do shit like this.

Because Riot promote trolling and punish the victims.

Just look at the mechanics. A single troll will destroy hundreds or thousands of matches for others before they get punished, and even then the punishment won't prevent them from continuing to troll, whereas everyone who tries to fight the troll gets punished as well, and those who try to escape the trolling even get punished immediately by LeaverBuster.

Even if you do nothing at all, you are still being forced to actively play a lost and un-fun game while being harassed at the same time for up to an hour.
That is clearly giving the trolls all the power.

Because this is the only game that has players so sensitive, they get triggered by anything.

Try trolling in any other game than LoL, and notice how they react.

Trolls are so lazy these days. I'm a troll. But my mentality is, you troll the enemy team as much as your own. Make it fun to watch.

Trolling doesn't mean doing things that deliberately lose the game. It means doing something that shouldn't work and making it work. Like ADC Camille or AP Support Nasus. Or Taiko Ornn.

If more trolls thought this way, League would be a much more entertaining place.
